item.title: getopts in Bash
item.description: 1. Notice 2. Syntax 3. Reference(s) 1. Notice 1.1 getopts is different from getopt. 1.2 getopts runs on any system running bash in POSIX mode (e.g., set -o posix), getopt is a system tool varies in different systems. 1.3 getopts parses short options, which are a single dash ("-") and a letter or digit.e.g. -2, -d, and -D. It can also parse short options in combination, for instance -2dD. But each option will be treated seperately, i.
